question: How to make a fruit puree

answers.name: Gryphon Smith
answers.text:
Get some fruit and blanche it

…

Then

Get a blender

Blend.

…

Or

Get a sieve

Push through the sieve.

….

Or get a food grinder

Put fruit in and grind it up.

….

Each way gets you a fruit puree.

answers.name: Lynetta Carnes
answers.text:
The details depend on the kind of fruit used and how you’ll be using the puree.

It typically involves cooking, forcing it through a food mill or sieve, adding sugar and/or lemon juice, and maybe spices to taste.

If you’re doing a berry puree, you may heat them only enough so that the juice begins to release….. if you’re using quince, you’re going to have to simmer them 40–90 minutes, depending on how small you cut them and the temp.

Despite the fact that raw quince is as hard to cut as a rock and not at all tasty, cooked quince is fabulous and makes a spectacular puree to offset both meats and deserts - just adjust your seasonings appropriately.
